subject: Productivity
title: Herzberg's Two-Factor Theory
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Herzberg's Two-Factor Theory.

hook.text: Frederick Herzberg discovered that the things that make you unhappy at work aren't the opposite of what makes you happy.

buildup.text: Hygiene factors â€” salary, conditions, job security â€” prevent dissatisfaction but don't create motivation.

discovery.text: Motivators â€” achievement, recognition, meaningful work â€” create genuine engagement and drive.

twist.text: A raise stops complaints but doesn't inspire excellence. Companies that only fix hygiene factors stay mediocre.

climax.text: Real motivation comes from the work itself: challenge, growth, and impact. Money just keeps people from leaving.

punchline.text: Pay people enough to forget about money. Then motivate them.

quiz.question: What do hygiene factors like salary do according to Herzberg?
options: They prevent dissatisfaction but don't create motivation
